Hey FreddyPhantom, do you still take ideas/requests? Please I request the DC-10 cockpit for 2.5M.

@Lvdovicvs what mod did has them engines ?

They are the Firespitter turboprops. And actually they're under the fuel tab.

Hey guys,

I just finished my last exam before graduation, now I've got some time to fix all issues and to work on requested parts

But I've got something for you. It's a SR-71 Cockpit, but I tried to do it rather in vanilla style and not KAX. I hope you like it.. It's not finished, feedback, new ideas or suggestions would be awesome.

-Freddy

Hey guys,

I just finished my last exam before graduation, now I've got some time to fix all issues and to work on requested parts

But I've got something for you. It's a SR-71 Cockpit, but I tried to do it rather in vanilla style and not KAX. I hope you like it.. It's not finished, feedback, new ideas or suggestions would be awesome.

http://i.imgur.com/3p3Mc2d.png?1

-Freddy

Actually that's a pretty good idea. Because this will connect to existing parts which would need to be retextured otherwise. I Like it! Good to see you back, I'll call off search and rescue

I really like the texture, too.

Actually I'd like to see some positioning lights as a idea.

Hey guys,

I just finished my last exam before graduation, now I've got some time to fix all issues and to work on requested parts

I can't tell you how excited I am about this, great work!

Hey guys,

I just finished my last exam before graduation, now I've got some time to fix all issues and to work on requested parts

But I've got something for you. It's a SR-71 Cockpit, but I tried to do it rather in vanilla style and not KAX. I hope you like it.. It's not finished, feedback, new ideas or suggestions would be awesome.

Sweet Jebus, it's beautiful.

A word of note, the side windows wrap around IRL.

Also please make it a proper inline two seater

Thank you all for the nice feedback!!

Sweet Jebus, it's beautiful.

A word of note, the side windows wrap around IRL.

Also please make it a proper inline two seater

You're right, I've changed the window, it looks way better.

Do you think, I should add the small window for the second person in the back?

Thank you all for the nice feedback!!

You're right, I've changed the window, it looks way better.

Do you think, I should add the small window for the second person in the back?

I suggest making an inline pod to place behind the cockpit. That would allow you the option of building two. One for the flat rear cockpit and one for the bubble rear cockpit. Oh any new progress on the Osprey cockpit? Not to pry just looking forward to that one, it looked really good in the last pic you posted.

Thank you all for the nice feedback!!

You're right, I've changed the window, it looks way better.

Do you think, I should add the small window for the second person in the back?

Yeah, unless you're going for the original A-12 Oxcart look

here are some updated pictures:

Edited May 9, 2015 by FreddyPhantom

Nice the textures look a bit crisper in those pics, and the re-proportioned cockpit looks good too. Also, any new progress on the osprey? Really looking forward to that one.

Edited May 9, 2015 by V8jester
This is a great parts pack! Are you planning to add engines, or are you sticking to the cockpits?

here are some updated pictures:

http://i.imgur.com/WMPVI8F.png

http://i.imgur.com/mZ2FLN4.png

Yeah, I'd say that coming along beautiful
Some more progress

Oh man! That looks freaking cool! The Osprey is really taking shape. Nice work Freddy. And honestly I like the solid color, I'd skip the black nose. But you're driving, so I'm just looking forward to the destination.

Oh man! That looks freaking cool! The Osprey is really taking shape. Nice work Freddy. And honestly I like the solid color, I'd skip the black nose. But you're driving, so I'm just looking forward to the destination.

thanks! I tried it with a black nose, but this just didn't fit to the Osprey, so I'll keep the solid color.

If you have some more ideas, just tell me
Oh hey, how about the windscreen wiper shroud. It wouldn't be much of a change to the model you have.

Some more progress

http://i.imgur.com/bBbZIhi.png

http://i.imgur.com/k6K2tC8.png

Damn, that SR-71 cockpit is looking fantastic.

Also, could you please name it the Archangel?

Archangel was the name of the CIA project that led to the development of the SR-71, FYI.
